intro: Justicia borrerae, commonly known as Mexican firecracker, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking red, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in dry, sunny habitats. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, while the stems are square and somewhat hairy. The flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and hummingbirds, making it an important plant in local ecosystems.
